biography.summary: Rand Paul is an American physician and politician who has served as the junior United States Senator from Kentucky since 2011. A member of the Republican Party, he is the son of physician and former congressman Ron Paul. Paul is known for libertarian-leaning views on civil liberties, criminal justice reform, and limited government.

contact.office_address: 295 Russell Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

committees.name: Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions (HELP)

policy_positions.stance: Advocates for protecting privacy rights and limiting government surveillance.
Supports reduced government spending and lower taxes.
Non-interventionist and skeptical of long-term military engagements.
Supports market-based reforms and medical freedom.
